visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a spline chart with the following specifications: Chart type: spline, Chart title: Monthly Average Temperature, Axes and labels styling: Use a dark blue color (#003366) for the title, axis labels, and tick marks, with a font size of 14px. Data series: The data series should include monthly average temperatures for a year, with the series name 'Temperature'. Custom colors: Use a gradient from light blue (#ADD8E6) to dark blue (#003366) for the series. Additional configurations: Set the chart background to a light gray (#F0F0F0), add a legend at the bottom of the chart, and set the chart margins to 50 pixels on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a spline chart displaying monthly average temperatures. The chart is titled 'Monthly Average Temperature' and uses a dark blue color (#003366) for the title, axis labels, and tick marks, with a font size of 14px. The x-axis categories represent the months of the year, and a plot band is added to highlight a specific range. The y-axis is labeled 'Temperature (°C)' with the same styling. The data series includes monthly average temperatures, named 'Temperature', and uses a gradient from light blue (#ADD8E6) to dark blue (#003366) for the series color. The chart background is set to a light gray (#F0F0F0), and a legend is positioned at the bottom of the chart. The chart margins are set to 50 pixels on all sides for better spacing.
